name: chimerism
content:

biology
  specialized the fact or state in an organism of containing cells or tissues from two or more different species or from two or more genetically different living things: Chimerism becomes a sensitive topic when it involves growing entire human organs inside animals. There is growing evidence that chimerism at the cellular level might be more common than previously thought: our bodies could contain cells from our mothers and even grandparents. Related word
chimera
More examplesFewer examplesThe twins' chimerism was only apparent through genetic testing.Studying tissues from the marmosets, the geneticists found chimerism throughout.Known as "partial chimerism", the procedure uses a mixture of the patient's bone marrow and a donor's bone marrow that combine to form healthy new blood cells.
